intro: Callitriche stagnalis var. vulgaris, commonly known as common water starwort, is a small aquatic plant found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. It typically grows in dense mats on the water surface or submerged in shallow waters. The plant has small, floating leaves that are usually arranged in whorls around the stem. Its flowers are tiny and inconspicuous, often appearing in clusters near the water’s surface. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
